See our past recommendations here!Confession: I own several beautiful wooden cutting boards that I rarely use. For everyday prep, I default to lightweight, easy-to-clean plastic, despite being the person who would rather carry my groceries home in my bare hands than use a disposable bag. These days I can feel a little better about my habit by opting for Material’s colorful BPA-free boards, which are made from recycled plastic scraps and renewable sugarcane. The result: a chic and sustainable surface that can weather all my slicing and dicing. –Monica Khemsurov, co-founder of Sight UnseenBuy it: ReBoard Plastic Cutting Board, $70 for twoAll products featured on Healthyish are independently selected by our editors.
